events.event_description: Coal-fired electricity generation in the U.S. Lower 48 states decreased by 23% between 2021 and 2023, with most of the decline (19%) occurring between 2022 and 2023.
events.citation: Electricity generation from units that primarily consume coal in the U.S. Lower 48 states decreased for all hours of the day by about 23% between 2021 and 2023, according to our Form EIA-930, Hourly and Daily Balancing Authority Operations Report. Most of the decline occurred between 2022 and 2023, when coal-fired generation fell 19%

events.event_description: Natural gas spot prices at Henry Hub decreased by more than 60% between 2022 and 2023.
events.citation: Most of the decline occurred between 2022 and 2023, when coal-fired generation fell 19% and the average natural gas spot price at the Henry Hub decreased by more than 60%

events.event_description: Operators have retired approximately 37 gigawatts (17%) of coal-fired fleet capacity since the beginning of 2021.
events.citation: Coal capacity has decreased because operators have retired about 37 gigawatts, or 17% of the coal-fired fleet, since the beginning of 2021

events.event_description: Off-peak coal-fired generation decreased by 24% between 2021 and 2023, with natural gas-fired units replacing coal units for overnight electricity generation.
events.citation: Off-peak, coal-fired generation fell about 24% between 2021 and 2023, according to our data, due largely to natural gas-fired units displacing coal-fired units as an overnight source of electricity
